{{Day}}

==Events==
* [[303]] &ndash; [[Roman Emperor]] [[Diocletian]] orders the destruction of the [[Christianity|Christian]] church in [[Nicomedia]], beginning eight years of [[Diocletianic Persecution]].
* [[532]] &ndash; [[List of Byzantine emperors|Byzantine Emperor]] [[Justinian I]] orders the building of a new [[Eastern Orthodox Church|Orthodox Christian]] [[basilica]] in [[Constantinople]] &ndash; the [[Hagia Sophia]].
*[[1455]] &ndash; Traditional date for the publication of the [[Gutenberg Bible]], the first [[Western culture|Western]] [[book]] printed with [[movable type]].
*[[1554]] &ndash; [[Mapuche]] forces, under the leadership of [[Lautaro]], score a victory over the [[Spanish Empire|Spanish]] at the [[Battle of Marihueñu]] in [[Chile]].
*[[1739]] &ndash; Richard Palmer is identified at [[York Castle]], by his former schoolteacher, as the outlaw [[Dick Turpin]].
*[[1778]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Friedrich Wilhelm von Steuben|Baron von Steuben]] arrives at [[Valley Forge, Pennsylvania]] to help to train the [[Continental Army]].
*[[1820]] &ndash; [[Cato Street Conspiracy]]: A plot to murder all the [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|British]] cabinet ministers is exposed.
*[[1821]] &ndash; [[Alexander Ypsilantis (1792–1828)|Alexander Ypsilantis]] starts the [[Greek War of Independence]] in [[Iași]], [[Wallachia]] (now part of [[Romania]]).
*[[1836]] &ndash; [[Texas Revolution]]: The [[Battle of the Alamo]] begins in [[San Antonio, Texas]].
*[[1847]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: [[Battle of Buena Vista]] &ndash; In Mexico, American troops under future president General [[Zachary Taylor]] defeat Mexican General [[Antonio López de Santa Anna]].
*[[1854]] &ndash; The official [[independence]] of the [[Orange Free State]] is declared.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President-elect]] [[Abraham Lincoln]] arrives secretly in [[Washington, D.C.]], after the thwarting of an alleged [[Baltimore Plot|assassination plot]] in [[Baltimore]], [[Maryland]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Reconstruction Era]]: Post-[[American Civil War|U.S. Civil War]] military control of [[Mississippi]] ends and it is readmitted to the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]].
*[[1883]] &ndash; [[Alabama]] becomes the first [[U.S. state]] to enact an [[Competition law|anti-trust law]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Sino-French War]]: French Army gains an important victory in the [[Battle of Đồng Đăng]] in the [[Tonkin]] region of Vietnam.
*[[1886]] &ndash; [[Charles Martin Hall]] produced the first samples of man-made [[aluminum]], after several years of intensive work. He was assisted in this project by his older sister Julia Brainerd Hall.
*[[1887]] &ndash; The [[French Riviera]] is hit by a large [[earthquake]], killing around 2,000.
*[[1896]] &ndash; The [[Tootsie Roll]] is invented.
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Émile Zola]] is imprisoned in France after writing "[[J'accuse (letter)|J'accuse]]", a letter accusing the [[Government of France|French government]] of [[antisemitism]] and wrongfully imprisoning [[Captain (OF-2)|Captain]] [[Alfred Dreyfus]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: [[Boer]]s and British troops fight in the [[Battle of Hart's Hill]].
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Cuba]] leases [[Guantanamo Bay Naval Base|Guantánamo Bay]] to the United States "in perpetuity".
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]] attorney [[Paul P. Harris|Paul Harris]] and three other businessmen meet for lunch to form the [[Rotary Club]], the world's first [[service club]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; The [[AEA Silver Dart]] makes the first powered flight in Canada and the [[British Empire]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; First demonstrations in [[Saint Petersburg]], Russia. The beginning of the [[February Revolution]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; Last monarch of [[Mecklenburg-Strelitz]] commits [[suicide]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Calvin Coolidge]] signs a bill by [[United States Congress|Congress]] establishing the [[Federal Radio Commission]] (later replaced by the [[Federal Communications Commission]]) which was to regulate the use of [[radio]] frequencies in the United States.
*  1927   &ndash; [[Germans|German]] [[theoretical physics|theoretical physicist]] [[Werner Heisenberg]] writes a letter to fellow physicist [[Wolfgang Pauli]], in which he describes his [[uncertainty principle]] for the first time.
*[[1934]] &ndash; [[Leopold III of Belgium|Leopold III]] becomes King of Belgium.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[Plutonium]] is first produced and isolated by Dr. [[Glenn T. Seaborg]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Empire of Japan|Japanese]] submarines [[Bombardment of Ellwood|fire artillery shells]] at the [[California]] coastline near [[Santa Barbara, California|Santa Barbara]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; A fire breaks out at St. Joseph's Orphanage, [[County Cavan]], Ireland, killing 36 people (35 of whom are children).
*  1943   &ndash; [[Greek Resistance]]: The [[United Panhellenic Organization of Youth]] is founded is Greece.
*[[1944]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] begins the [[Operation Lentil (Caucasus)|forced deportation]] of the [[Chechen people|Chechen]] and [[Ingush people]] from the [[North Caucasus]] to [[Central Asia]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: During the [[Battle of Iwo Jima]], a group of [[United States Marine]]s and a commonly forgotten U.S. Navy Corpsman, reach the top of [[Mount Suribachi]] on the island and are [[Raising the Flag on Iwo Jima|photographed raising the American flag]].
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: The [[11th Airborne Division]], with [[Filipino people|Filipino]] guerrillas, free the captives of the [[Los Baños, Laguna|Los Baños]] internment camp.
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: The capital of the [[Philippines]], [[Manila]], is liberated by combined Filipino and American forces.
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: Capitulation of German garrison in [[Poznań]]. The city is liberated by [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] and Polish forces.
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: The German town of [[Pforzheim]] is [[Bombing of Pforzheim in World War II|annihilated]] in a raid by 379 British bombers.
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO) is founded.
*[[1954]] &ndash; The first mass inoculation of children against [[Poliomyelitis|polio]] with the [[Jonas Salk|Salk]] [[vaccine]] begins in [[Pittsburgh]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; First meeting of the [[Southeast Asia Treaty Organization]] (SEATO).
*[[1958]] &ndash; Cuban rebels kidnap 5-time world [[F1]] champion [[Juan Manuel Fangio]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; In [[Syria]], [[Ba'ath Party]] member [[Salah Jadid]] leads an intra-party military [[coup]] that replaces the previous government of General [[Amin Hafiz]], also a Baathist.
*[[1974]] &ndash; The [[Symbionese Liberation Army]] demands $4 million more to release kidnap victim [[Patty Hearst]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Iran hostage crisis]]: [[Supreme Leader of Iran|Supreme Leader]] [[Ayatollah]] [[Ruhollah Khomeini]] states that Iran's parliament will decide the fate of the American embassy hostages.
*[[1981]] &ndash; In Spain, [[Antonio Tejero]] attempts [[23-F|a coup d'état]] by capturing the [[Congress of Deputies (Spain)|Spanish Congress of Deputies]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; The [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]] announces its intent to buy out and evacuate the [[Polychlorinated dibenzodioxins|dioxin]]-contaminated community of [[Times Beach, Missouri]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Supernova 1987a]] is seen in the [[Large Magellanic Cloud]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Gulf War]]: Ground troops cross the [[Saudi Arabia]]n border and enter [[Iraq]], thus beginning the [[Gulf War#Ground campaign|ground phase]] of the war.
*  1991   &ndash; In [[Thailand]], General [[Sunthorn Kongsompong]] leads a bloodless [[coup d'état]], deposing Prime Minister [[Chatichai Choonhavan]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; In the United States, [[Kissimmee Tornado Outbreak|tornadoes in central Florida]] destroy or damage 2,600 structures and kill 42.
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Kurds|Kurdish]] rebel leader [[Abdullah Öcalan]] is charged with [[treason]] in [[Ankara]], [[Turkey]].
*  1999   &ndash; An [[avalanche]] destroys the Austrian village of [[Galtür]], killing 31.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The controversial [[French law on colonialism]] is passed, requiring teachers to teach the "positive values of colonialism".  After public outcry, it is repealed at the beginning of [[2006]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; A [[Grayrigg rail crash|train derails]] on an evening express service near [[Grayrigg]], [[Cumbria]], England, killing one person and injuring 22. This results in hundreds of points being checked over the UK after a few similar accidents.
*[[2008]] &ndash; A [[United States Air Force|U.S. Air Force]] [[B-2 Spirit]] bomber [[Andersen Air Force Base B-2 accident|crashes]] on [[Guam]]. It is the first operational loss of a B-2.
*[[2010]] &ndash; Unknown criminals pour more than 2.5 million liters of [[diesel oil]] and other [[hydrocarbons]] into the river [[Lambro]], in [[Northern Italy]], sparking an [[environmental disaster]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[23 February 2012 Iraq attacks|series of attacks]] across [[Iraq]] leave at least 83 killed and more than 250 injured.
*[[2014]] &ndash; The [[2014 Winter Olympics closing ceremony|closing ceremony]] of the [[2014 Winter Olympics|Winter Olympics]] take place in [[Sochi]], [[Russia]].
